body: Many a book is like a key to unknown chambers within the castle of one's own self.
Order and simplification are the first steps towards the mastery of a subject.
I have not failed. I've just found 10.000 ways that won't work.
Art and science have their meeting-point in method.
A true adventure starts when imagination collides with reality.
There is something irreversible about acquiring knowledge; and the simulation of the search for it differs in a most profound way from the reality.
Free will is to mind what chance is to matter.
Have lots of ideas and throw away the bad ones.
Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very;' your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be.
It is my ambition to say in ten sentences what others say in a whole book.
